CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: However , the rms roughness is somewhat reduced to from 0.47 to 0.43 nm with thermal treatment , being favorable for charge separation and transport. This can reasonably explain the enhanced efficiency via the postannealing effect. Note that , in stark contrast to PCDTBT : PC71BM system in which thermal annealing reduced the photovoltaic parameters ( FF , J SC , and V OC ) , 22 the performance of all PCDSeBT - based devices for this study is considerably improved as a result of thermal treatment. We can conclude that the formation of crystalline nanoscale domains would be slightly induced in PCDSeBT : PC71BM with a thermal treatment in consequence of the ordered crystalline nature of the PCDSeBT on annealing as supported by the XRD results above as well as the large quinoidal character in the polymer backbone as the inclusion of selenophene. 23 The AFM of the annealed film gives an evidence for slightly nanofibril - like organization ( see Figure 5b ). The hole and electron mobilities of PCDSeBT : PC71BM ( 1 : 4 w / w ) blends were measured using the space - charge - limited current ( SCLC ) method and the J-V characteristics were plotted in Figure 6. The hole mobility ( μ hole = 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s ) obtained with the thermally annealed film is one order higher than that without post annealing ( μ hole = 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2 / V°s ) , whereas in the both cases , the electron mobilities ( μ electron ) are similar ( 1.24 × 10^-3 and 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s ) for as-cast and annealed films , respectively , yielding a smaller difference between the mobility ratio for the annealed film. The higher mobilities and more balanced charge transport should definitely favor the charge transportation in the blend film and lead to high solar cell performance , supporting the b e n e fi c i a l e ff e c t o f t h e t h e r m a l a n n e a l i n g o n PCDSeBT : PC71BM cells . In conclusion , diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) units have successfully been incorporated into a D-A polymer backbone by Suzuki polymerization with 2,7-carbazole comonomer , affording a poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) ; This design motif is that replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units in PCDTBT that acts as a superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs , induces a lower bandgap ( 1.70 eV ) than that of PCDTBT ( 1.85 eV ) , while the ideal HOMO energy level ( -5.40 eV ) is still maintained.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCDTBT: This is a material name, specifically a type of polymer (poly(3,4-ethylene dioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) with thiophene units).
2. PC71BM: This is another material name, specifically a fullerene derivative ([6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester).
3. PCDSeBT: This is a material name, specifically a polymer with a diselenienylbenzothiadiazole unit in its backbone.
4. DSeBT: This is a material name, specifically diselenienylbenzothiadiazole units.
5. Suzuki polymerization: This is a chemical reaction method, not a material name, but it is used to synthesize PCDSeBT.
6. 2,7-carbazole: This is a comonomer used in the synthesis of PCDSeBT.
7. D-A polymer: This is a type of polymer with a donor-acceptor structure.
8. PSCs: This stands for Perovskite Solar Cells.
9. Thiophenes: This is a type of heterocyclic compound, specifically a five-membered ring with sulfur atoms.
10. Selenophene: This is a type of heterocyclic compound, specifically a five-membered ring with selenium atoms.
11. XRD: This stands for X-ray diffraction, a technique used to determine the crystal structure of materials.
12. AFM: This stands for Atomic Force Microscopy, a technique used to image and measure the topography and properties of surfaces at the atomic level.
13. SCLC: This stands for Space Charge Limited Current, a method used to measure the mobility of charge carriers in a material.
14. HOMO: This stands for Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital, a quantum mechanical concept describing the energy level of the last electron in a material.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PCDTBT
2. PC71BM
3. PCDSeBT
4. DSeBT
5. Thiophenes
6. Selenophene

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| PCDSeBT |
| DSeBT |
| Thiophenes |
| Selenophene |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: However , the rms roughness is somewhat reduced to from 0.47 to 0.43 nm with thermal treatment , being favorable for charge separation and transport. This can reasonably explain the enhanced efficiency via the postannealing effect. Note that , in stark contrast to PCDTBT : PC71BM system in which thermal annealing reduced the photovoltaic parameters ( FF , J SC , and V OC ) , 22 the performance of all PCDSeBT - based devices for this study is considerably improved as a result of thermal treatment. We can conclude that the formation of crystalline nanoscale domains would be slightly induced in PCDSeBT : PC71BM with a thermal treatment in consequence of the ordered crystalline nature of the PCDSeBT on annealing as supported by the XRD results above as well as the large quinoidal character in the polymer backbone as the inclusion of selenophene. 23 The AFM of the annealed film gives an evidence for slightly nanofibril - like organization ( see Figure 5b ). The hole and electron mobilities of PCDSeBT : PC71BM ( 1 : 4 w / w ) blends were measured using the space - charge - limited current ( SCLC ) method and the J-V characteristics were plotted in Figure 6. The hole mobility ( μ hole = 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s ) obtained with the thermally annealed film is one order higher than that without post annealing ( μ hole = 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2 / V°s ) , whereas in the both cases , the electron mobilities ( μ electron ) are similar ( 1.24 × 10^-3 and 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s ) for as-cast and annealed films , respectively , yielding a smaller difference between the mobility ratio for the annealed film. The higher mobilities and more balanced charge transport should definitely favor the charge transportation in the blend film and lead to high solar cell performance , supporting the b e n e fi c i a l e ff e c t o f t h e t h e r m a l a n n e a l i n g o n PCDSeBT : PC71BM cells . In conclusion , diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) units have successfully been incorporated into a D-A polymer backbone by Suzuki polymerization with 2,7-carbazole comonomer , affording a poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) ; This design motif is that replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units in PCDTBT that acts as a superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs , induces a lower bandgap ( 1.70 eV ) than that of PCDTBT ( 1.85 eV ) , while the ideal HOMO energy level ( -5.40 eV ) is still maintained.

Let's think step by step.

1. rms roughness: surface property of the film
2. thermal treatment: process of heating the material
3. charge separation: process of separating positive and negative charges in a material
4. transport: movement of charges or particles in a material
5. FF (fill factor): efficiency parameter of a solar cell
6. J SC (short circuit current): efficiency parameter of a solar cell
7. VOC (open circuit voltage): efficiency parameter of a solar cell
8. PCDTBT: name of a material (poly(3,4-ethylene dioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) with thiophene units)
9. PC71BM: name of a material ([6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester)
10. crystalline nanoscale domains: structural property of a material
11. XRD (X-ray diffraction): analytical technique
12. AFM (atomic force microscopy): analytical technique
13. hole mobility (μ hole): material property
14. electron mobility (μ electron): material property
15. SCLC (space-charge-limited current): method for measuring material properties
16. J-V (current-voltage): graphical representation of material properties
17. PCDSeBT: name of a material (poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole))
18. Suzuki polymerization: chemical reaction
19. 2,7-carbazole comonomer: chemical compound
20. DSeBT units: chemical units
21. bandgap: energy difference between the valence band and the conduction band in a material
22. HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital): energy level in a material.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. rms roughness

6. J SC (short circuit current)
7. VOC (open circuit voltage)
8. hole mobility (μ hole)
9. electron mobility (μ electron)

11. HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital)

This can reasonably explain the enhanced efficiency via the postannealing effect. Note that , in stark contrast to PCDTBT : PC71BM system in which thermal annealing reduced the photovoltaic parameters ( FF , J SC , and V OC ) , 22 the performance of all PCDSeBT - based devices for this study is considerably improved as a result of thermal treatment. The hole and electron mobilities of PCDSeBT : PC71BM ( 1 : 4 w / w ) blends were measured using the space - charge - limited current ( SCLC ) method and the J-V characteristics were plotted in Figure 6. The hole mobility ( μ hole = 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s ) obtained with the thermally annealed film is one order higher than that without post annealing ( μ hole = 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2 / V°s ) , whereas in the both cases , the electron mobilities ( μ electron ) are similar ( 1.24 × 10^-3 and 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s ) for as-cast and annealed films , respectively , yielding a smaller difference between the mobility ratio for the annealed film. The higher mobilities and more balanced charge transport should definitely favor the charge transportation in the blend film and lead to high solar cell performance , supporting the b e n e fi c i a l e ff e c t o f t h e t h e r m a l a n n e a l i n g o n PCDSeBT : PC71BM cells . In conclusion , diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) units have successfully been incorporated into a D-A polymer backbone by Suzuki polymerization with 2,7-carbazole comonomer , affording a poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) ; This design motif is that replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units in PCDTBT that acts as a superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs , induces a lower bandgap ( 1.70 eV ) than that of PCDTBT ( 1.85 eV ) , while the ideal HOMO energy level ( -5.40 eV ) is still maintained.

Let's think step by step.

1. RMS roughness: from 0.47 nm to 0.43 nm (nm)
2. Formation of crystalline nanoscale domains in PCDSeBT: PC71BM (dimensionless)
3. Hole mobility of PCDSeBT: PC71BM (1 : 4 w/w) blends: 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s (cm^2 / V°s)
4. Hole mobility of PCDSeBT: PC71BM (1 : 4 w/w) blends without post annealing: 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2 / V°s (cm^2 / V°s)
5. Electron mobility of PCDSeBT: PC71BM (1 : 4 w/w) blends (as-cast film): 1.24 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s (cm^2 / V°s)
6. Electron mobility of PCDSeBT: PC71BM (1 : 4 w/w) blends (annealed film): 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s (cm^2 / V°s)
7. Bandgap of PCDSeBT: 1.70 eV (eV)
8. Ideal HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT: -5.40 eV (eV)
9. Bandgap of PCDTBT: 1.85 eV (eV)
